tool.name: xhmm discover
tool.description: Discover CNVs from normalized read depth matrix
tool.command: #if str( $send_sample.send_sample_sel ) == "send": echo ${send_sample.sample} > sample_file.txt && xhmm --discover --paramFile $paramFile --readDepths $readDepths --origReadDepths $origReadDepths --discoverSomeQualThresh $qualThresh --xcnv "./xhmm_discover_out.xcnv" --keepSampleIDs sample_file.txt #else xhmm --discover --paramFile $paramFile --readDepths $readDepths --origReadDepths $origReadDepths --discoverSomeQualThresh $qualThresh --xcnv "./xhmm_discover_out.xcnv" #end if 2&> "log.txt"

param.name: readDepths
param.label: Matrix of normalized read-depths to use for CNV annotation, where rows (samples) and columns (targets) are labeled

param.name: origReadDepths
param.label: Matrix of unnormalized read-depths to use for CNV annotation, where rows (samples) and columns (targets) are labeled

param.name: qualThresh
param.label: Quality threshold for discovering a CNV in a sample

param.name: send_sample_sel
param.label: Only produce output for given sample

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool uses XHMM_ to discover CNVs from normalized read depth matrix
.. _XHMM: http://atgu.mgh.harvard.edu/xhmm/index.shtml
------
**Citation**
For the underlying tool, please cite:
Menachem Fromer and Shaun M. Purcell. Using XHMM software to detect copy number variation in whole-exome sequencing data. In Current Protocols in Human Genetics. John Wiley and Sons, Inc., 2014
